plot: Deanna is impregnated by an unknown alien life-form, and Dr. Katherine Pulaski joins the Enterprise as the ship's new Chief Medical Officer.

The ship has a new chief medical officer, Dr. Katherine Pulaski, now that Beverley Crusher has been made head of Starfleet Medical. The Enterprise is on an emergency mission to collect plague samples for analysis but Counselor Troi unexpectedly finds herself pregnant. She also finds her pregnancy advancing very quickly with conception to birth expected to take no more than 48 hours. Once born the child, whom Troi names Ian Andrew after her father, grows at a rapid rate proceeding through childhood in a matter of hours. Meanwhile Guinan, who tends the bar in Ten Forward, a crew lounge, gives Wesley Crusher some advice.—garykmcd

Wesley Crusher copes well with being 'alone' now his mother has accepted a promotion on the ground, sad to be scheduled to leave the Enterprise to join her. The new chief medical officer is immediately thrown into the deep: during a mission to transport dangerous plague germ mutations to a dying planet, Troi reports an inexplicable pregnancy without even meeting any male which produces an incredibly fast-growing son, genetically filly and only hers. Then newly promoted chief engineer La Forge's containment system mysteriously starts breaking down, boding fatal contamination for everyone aboard. Talking to enigmatic alien bartender Guinan helps Wesley make up his mind.—KGF Vissers
